Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: phil b Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: loved our stay, friendly immaculate and would gladly go back. Ideal location for the football stadium and exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Why does this hotel have four stars in the name?”
Reviews.Author: Thomas T
Reviews.Content: The service is kind of confusing. because the front desk is very very helpful, but in the breakfast it was kind of "ignorance". the room is smelling drain in some times, under the bed there is dust. one cool feature is that the water is blue-ish from the chlore ( don't know if its a Barcelona-thing =) ) The bed are in my opinion little to hard. and when we were on our way to it, i had a more fancy imagination about the room. hey.. its says four stars =) The free wifi is a joke, it should be named 28.8 kbs, honestly! But i can understand that its a 3:rd part service on that, and of course.. there is a pay-option on that and you get faster internet and even mail-client service. The free wifi is only for browsing the net. the breakfast isn't anything to get excited about… dry bread, "chemical orange juice", no green as tomatoes or cucumber. dry cheese. very nice baguette although! The food on the restaurant is a disappointment. i ordered tagliatele carbonara. The pasta was kind of "2 min in micro-sticky" and the sauce was lumpy, like it had been defrosted to fast. but i can have wrong on that. But! i have taste aloooot of carbonaras around the world and this was actually the worst i have tasted. And about the communications with the staff. Ok, i can understand that people here aren't so great with english.. But i would like to see that the waiter could at least help us out what the fish dishes had for fish in them. One miss was when i booked the hotel on my hometown… its waaay off the city, we have to spend about 25 euro on taxi each day =) and the spa was very expensive. 13 euro for 90 minutes just to access the pools. This hotel is very ok if you are here for the FC barcelona football games. Very close to the arena.. a ball-kick away ;)

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value”
Reviews.Author: Costin C
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel located a few minutes away from the Metro station. We received a big room with an excelent bathroom. The hotel is located within a walking distance to Camp Nou, 30 minutes from the centre by metro. Breakfast is superb...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Nou Camp”
Reviews.Author: Nailz
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were in Barcelona to watch football at the Nou Camp. Location is great for this but not for town centre. We walked to La Rambla on our first day which took about 90 minutes. The metro station is a 5 minute walk away and offers easy access into town. Hotel Room was on small side but clean and adequate for a 3 night stay. We did not use any hotel facilities so cannot comment on those. Plenty of places in the vicinity to eat or you can get metro into town for restaurants. Taxi from airport cost 32 euros. Better bet is to get a T10 train ticket from airport which you can use on airport train and metro. At 9 Euros for 10 journeys its a bargain, and can be used by more than one person.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cheadleblue
Reviews.Content: First the good points: + located close to Barcelona FC + bedrooms/bathrooms clean + aircon/heating in bedroom quiet and effective Not so good: - very dated building and interior, 70s era Soviet bloc school of architecture - food and drink options limited and dull - no views from rooms - you have to pay extra to use steam room/spa even when staying as a guest - dull area, away from the great city centre - full of school parties runing up and down the corridors at all hours but the thing that really spoilt my visit, compared to previous excellent times in Barcelona, was the front-desk staff. Clearly they held a duplicate booking for me but refused to back down. As another reviewer has said - 'The Hotel that doesn't care'. Hard to believe this hotel can be classed as a 4 star (who by?) - there are many many better options in Barcelona for the money paid (around €120/night).

Reviews.Title: “excellent service near camp nou”
Reviews.Author: molkircho
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the stadium. Metro is 5 minutes away on foot. We stayed in a small 3 person room which had ask the accommodations needed. the staff were extremely helpful. Very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that dosen't care”
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on a business trip. Found the Hotel unsafe the staff not all interested. Never have I stayed in a Hotel where I witnessed luggage been robbed from the lobby and experienced a front of house staff hand out a map for directions to the police station instead of calling them. The manager had to be asked to come out of the office by guests to listen to the complaint and couldn't of cared less. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “terrible, unsafe and not helpful. avoid at all costs dangerous”
Reviews.Author: luap1001
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel with group to work at exhibition. you lady in our group had her bags stolen from lobby as she sat there in the morning 8.00am. others in our group chased the theif but didnt catch. the hotel staff would not help or call poloice but gave a map and sent her to the police station. they would not call police THIS HOTEL HAS NO SECURITY. after this event we learnt that this hotel has no security staff at all. very concerning in a city with high unemployment and crime rate the lack of security staff means anyone can walk around the hotel and all floors without challenge. obviously very unsafe for women alone who could get knock at doir and then open....doors have no viewing hole this hotel is unsafe and dangerous

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Nou Camp > Great links for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: KarlandCathJohnson
Reviews.Content: Amazing location for Nou Camp stadium, merely a 10 minute walk to the ground The underground is a 4min walk........ Free mini bar in rooms, well decorated and extremely clean! Perfect hotel and a perfect stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SpinWidgets
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in Barca! Thanks for the great service (even though the WiFi was iffy.)

Reviews.Title: “CLOSE TO THE NOU CAMP BUT NOT A LOT ELSE”
Reviews.Author: SCRATCHCABSYEAH
Reviews.Content: The room was very good as was the bathroom,the bed was very large and firm but no problems.the only downside was the tv which was an older model and with only one english language station the bbc world news which didnt vary a lot hourly.the spa was free but only on one visit which wasnt that clear on booking,the hotel was very quiet but this was to be expected at this time of the year.The nou camp was very near and with buses outside the hotel the city centre could be got to in 20minutes as there wasnt much to do around the area.

Reviews.Title: “modern and nice”
Reviews.Author: emelinammr
Reviews.Content: We stay there for 2 days as part of a tour group. The rooms were very modern, roomy and comfortable. Everything was clean. The service was excellent and personel was friendly and helpful.The only negative comment is the location. Although it is close to the Stadium, it is not very centric for other tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Samuel C
Reviews.Content: I experienced a very pleasant stay at the Senator Barcelona Spa Hotel, whilst visting Barcelona on a business trip. The hotel staff were pleasant, remembered my instructions for taxi, wake-up calls, etc. - impressive personal service. Room/bathroom was neat, clean and tidy - very livable. Breakfast was excellent. There was wireless free internet service available in my room - definite plus for me to keep connected to family and my organisation back home. The hotel was centrally located to amenities, my conference center, Nou Camp Stadium (I actually walked to the stadium, watched Barcelona FC play and walked back at around 11pm), close to restuarants and public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Catalonian is cool”
Reviews.Author: celty2k
Reviews.Content: My head was spinning, I had read so many reviews about so many different hotels in Barcelona. Finally my wife and I settled on this one. We wanted to be just outside the city centre, away from the non-stop noise of an urban environment. And this did the trick. And so it was, that we heaved our cases onto the Renfe train and then the Metro, up hill and down dale, until we finally arrived at the Senator. The hotel seemed to be totally surrounded by apartment blocks. But the entrance was very pleasant. We met one of the nicest and most professional receptionists, a chap called José. We were far too early to check in, yet he handed over our keys anyway. The room was a very interesting 'L'-shape, which meant the built-in wardrobe was by the door, followed by the bathroom, and then the bedroom itself, through a connecting door. The whole arrangement gave the impression of a mini-apartment. Most satisfactory. The only downsides were the occasional 'drainy' smell - which occurred momentarily twice in our five-day stay - and the fact that the room was a touch on the dark side. Not 'dark' as in 'evil', I'd like to add! We had a kettle that refused to switch off, but José had that replaced with a new one straightaway. And he stressed there was a free mini-bar in the room, encouraging us to make full use of it. There was also a safe – and a shoe horn! We had paid for room only. Sometimes we ate at the hotel, sometimes we ate at other restaurants. The hotel's meals turned out to be competitively priced. I thought the seafood paella was a bit small. But another evening we ordered a starter and there was so much food, we ended up cancelling the rest of the meal and just headed straight for the bar! We got to know the bar staff, Taullant and Raul, who were among the warmest and friendliest blokes you could meet. Nothing was too much trouble for them. I would consider going back to this hotel just to chat with them again over a wine or a cocktail. At one point I had a problem with a nearby cash machine outside the hotel, so the concierge Davide came with me and guided me through it. The staff at this place are really quite excellent. The spa looked great, but this was an extra cost and we were watching our holiday budget. If we had stayed longer, we may have used the spa a couple of times. The rooftop pool is free and looks lovely, though it was shut for the autumn and winter season. However, we were in Barcelona for the culture – of which there is plenty. The Senator is a short walk from the Metro station, and we soon got used to the system. This hotel is a gateway to a whole treasure trove of Catalonian art and architecture, as well as being a short walk from FC Barcelona's ground, Camp Nou, and within easy reach of local banks, cafes and supermarkets. It was hard saying 'goodbye', it was such a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Msgamal
Reviews.Content: Very good staff, very clean, good ac. Not that good location,. But overall it's great. Must try the spa

Reviews.Title: “If it was back home it would be 2 star at most”
Reviews.Author: Scatesy83
Reviews.Content: Hotel was def not 4 star for a start air con didn't wrk the window didn't close properly it very dated with yellow Walls and old fashion like stuff your granny would have in the 80s.would not stay ere even again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Senator, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Anita D
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at this hotel for a night before a weeks cruise and 3 nights after the cruise. I was a bit worried when I read some reviews but I think these people must have stayed at a different hotel. I thought it was lovely, clean and friendly. My husband had his wallet stolen while we were away with our room key inside and we had no trouble at all in getting this replaced. The staff are so helpful and cheerful. Rooms are very spacious and the roof pool is lovely. I would certainly go again. It is so easy to get about as this is only a five minutes away from the metro and it is so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: d3NY
Reviews.Content: Free swimming pool at the top, near Camp Nou, bus stop is 20m from hotel, free mini bar (coca cola 2x, juice 2x, bear 2x)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, but hated it...”
Reviews.Author: shpatel2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not in the tourist area, which was what we wanted. It was close enough for us to take the subway to those areas. There weren't many restaurants nearby though. The hotel was big, very nice when you walk in. We checked in after midnight, get up to our room, only to find that the bathroom was dirty (towels used) and an open pepsi bottle in the room. The beds were made but obviously the room had been used by someone. So we went back down and requested another room. They gave us the handicapped room, which was huge, as usual. PROS: 1. The mini bar is free for all guests. Although, it only included pepsi, orange juice, water, and non-alcoholic beer. 2. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The housekeeping was very generous with refilling our mini bar and giving us extra supplies (towels, toilet paper, sheets, toiletries, etc.) 3. The hotel's ambiance in the lobby was very nice with a restaurant, business center, lounge area... 4. The beds were extremely comfortable, with down comforters and fluffy pillows. 5. They had a lot of spa options, which on one of the days we were there, was 50% a few services. (massages mostly) 6. The hotel provided a decent sized safe in our room which we were able to use CONS: 1. Our new room was at the very back of the hotel, and on the 2nd floor (which happened to be street level). I did not feel safe at all when it came to the window in the bathroom. 2. I opened the covers to the bed, only to find a small bug crawling under the pillow. The beds were nice, the most comfortable we experienced in Spain, and even had the bed adjusting remotes (which I assume were b/c of the handicapped room?). I proceeded to sleep on the other side of the bed, where after our second night's stay, I found another small bug, a different type of bug, crawling in between the pillow and headboard. 3. The wifi only worked in the lobby. You cannot catch signal anywhere else, so it was inconvenient for us to have to go down to the lobby every time I wanted to check something on my iPhone or Nook... they also charge to use their computers in the business center which was not what we experienced at other hotels in Spain. 4. We paid for the spa b/c the pictures of it looked amazing, and we were very disappointed when we walked in. It was small, dark, and there was one creepy guy in one of the jet spas that would NOT leave. Overall, the hotel was very nice, but for the price, would have expected NO bugs in the bed, and wifi all over the hotel

Reviews.Title: “4* with objections”
Reviews.Author: Verka24
Reviews.Content: Pros: I really enjoyed the quiet location which was so soothing after all day in the noisy city center (though close to the metro station). Free non-alcoholic mini-bar was great and so was the free swimming pool on the roof. Free wifi (but quite a bad signal in our room). Cons: Reception staff - they seemed to be quite unsure with their english and I think that´s why they made us feel a bit unwelcome (they didn´t smile at all). Housekeeping - VERY negligent, we stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and we had ONE roll of toilet paper for the whole stay!!! Even if there was really very little left, the housekeeping didn´t replace it with the new one. This really shouldn´t happen in a 4*!!!!!! Sometimes it seemed that the only thing the housekeeping did was making the bed and taking out trash. I was very disappointed with the housekeeping service. Once they "forgot" to refill our coffee and tea and the minibar but this we could survive...

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Snowyann
Reviews.Content: Room are small and could be cleaner. Furniture are old. The Spa center is 15 Euros per person. I've expected more for a 4 star hotel. Good point, free wifi in the whole hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OMG…where were my eyes”
Reviews.Author: wnt2trvel4life
Reviews.Content: OMG…where were my eyes, when I was mapping this hotel! This hotel is FAR!!!! When I found it I was excited since it was with in the budget I was looking for, when we got to the hotel I wanted to kick myself (after I did). It is all the way by the stadium, metro is few blocks down. Location of this hotel is not great at all if you want to explore Barcelona and be in the center. I am still kicking myself. There were a lot of elderly people in the hotel! Hotel has a pool/spa…I did not go as I thought it would be free for guests, NO…2 hrs for pool = 15 Euros! Breakfast = 15 Euros for… Get this….Coffee, Milk and some other item….I am still thinking this is a joke, if I have milk only…15 Euros for Milk??!! Super Breakfast = 20 something Euros….here we go…. Coffee, Milk and some other item + egg and bacon When leaving the hotel we walked straight down (passed the light) street like you going downhill feeling on the left had a nice café place with fresh croissants, pastries, Panini, delish coffee …. We had 2 croissants 2 coffee and other stuff my bill was never over 10 euros for BOTH! Room was spacey and clean…loved how the widow slid to the side and you can see out. Asked for a king/queen bed when booking …room had two twin beds set up as a queen/king, very uncomfortable! Kept getting into the middle, after so much walking there was no good rest on this bed, even though it could be adjusted to watch tv and what not, it was not comfortable! Another minus is you can hear people in the hallway, especially if they are not being considerate and the door slamming was heard which was like a slap if one is trying to sleep on this uncomfy bed. House keeping was mediocre on of the examples; we had toilet paper upon arrival less than half, upon cleaning the room after the first day, she leaves us a roll which has less then the one already hanging. So I have two rolls which do not equal to half of one! Hotel staff were indifferent, seemed like they did not want to be bothered. Asked to call to confirm my hotel/airport pick up, paper had info written in eng/span…stated its opened 24 hrs…she dialed and after two seconds told me there is no one there to call them after 4 and one of her “colleagues” here will do it, and that its siesta. She just did not want to do it, at a hotel in Madrid, they called and confirmed for me w/o any problem and it took 2 seconds! After we left hotel I called from my cell hoping there will be an English speaking person on the other line and alas I confirmed! They could not advise on what to do, where to go and so forth…I hesitated talking to them…. There is nothing about the hotel for me to say that I had a 4 star experience! And it was FAR! If I would have realized this before booking I definitely would have booked some where closer to the center. I would not recommend this hotel if one is planning to see the city. For elderly it is prob an ideal choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all-round experience”
Reviews.Author: BecLouLou
Reviews.Content: My partner arranged this holiday for us and chose this hotel based on the reviews and location; we weren't disappointed! Hotel - A stunning large reception area with a piano bar, bar restaurant, buffet restaurant, 3 lifts, internet room and spa. Rooms very spacious with recliner beds (brilliant for watching tv & reading), air con and fan, free mini-bar (we had 2 pepsi, 2 juice cartons, 2 bottles of water & 2 bottles of beer - Cruzcampo or low alcohol) restocked daily, lovely bathroom, the view wasn't overly impressive but can't complain with the area. Free WiFi too, just ask at reception for the codes. The rooftop lounge area and pool is lovely for a relax. Location - We normally go package holidays so did a fair bit of research on how to get from the airport to the hotel without having to be fleeced for a taxi ride! When you get out the airport, follow the signs for the Renfe train. Tip - When you get to the station, I would recommend buying a T-10 ticket from the machines on your right (these cost 7.85 euros and allow you to use the Renfe train, metro and buses in Zone 1 of Barcelona) and any of the trains at the station will take you to Barcelona Sants (3 stops away). Then get the L5 (blue) line on the metro towards to Collblanc then the hotel is around 10 min walk up the main road. The entire transport system in Barcelona is fantastic, so clean and efficient! This is a very residential area, which we quite liked, but neither of us able to speak much Spanish we did struggle at times, but the locals are very friendly! Most restaurants don't open until 9pm but something to get used to! A few little pastry cafes are dotted around the hotel which are perfect for breakfast! Camp Nou - A 10-15 minute walk down the road from the hotel, you can see the rooftop of the stadium from the road outside the hotel! We didn't go to a game, but I would definitely recommend the stadium tour! Tip - if you have a smart phone & Facebook account, use the hotel WiFi (or internet room if not) and check in at the Camp Nou (FC BARCELONA), I had to manually search it but it does pick it up! It has an offer for 2 for 1 at any Nou Camp experiences, just show the offer at the ticket booth and save 19 euros! Barcelona Centre - The metro stop Collblanc takes you straight to Segrada Familia (around 8 stops on the L5 line) and what a sight! We didn't do the tour bus, walked instead down to Las Ramblas then to sea front where we went to the aquarium and had lunch at a place called Gino's, which was amazing! Barcelona is an amazing place which will suit all ages and tastes, we will definitely be going back and recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned decor but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmickeeee
Reviews.Content: The decor is of a slightly different era but the hotel is a gem of a hotel very close to the Nou Camp and very close to a Metro which takes you all over the city. My family stayed here in July last summer and after a low day travelling from Milan we arrived at 11pm. The guy who served us was very quick and polite. When we arrived at the room we discovered the only mistake of the week. We had booked a family room but there was only one double bed. When we returned to the reception the guy was apoligetic and it seemed the mistake was at the hands of the booking agent we booked through. A quick call to house keeping and another room was made up in ten minutes. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. There is a pillow list on the room so if you need to change for a particular type of pillow you can call reception. The aircon was great with good control settings on it. There is a huge variety for breakfast and something for everyone. There is a great spa under the hotel which i took advantage off. On top of the hotel there is a very clean pool which was not that busy. A must when the temp rises. Overall a great hotel for a great city and not overpriced. I would highly recommend this hotel and will book again when i am back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great city-great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 187497Barcelona
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff. Close to Collblanc metro and lots of cafes and restaurants in Collblanc area. Cash points very nearby. Room was fine but on the small side for the four of us. One chair at a desk. Bunk beds were ok we took top ones off and placed on floor. New year and quiet at night. No traffic noise at all. No flightpath issues. Bar and restaurant but pricey. Breakfast can be got across the road at nearby Pans and coffee shop. Marios also just down the road inexpensive. Loads of bars and places to eat near Nou camp. City centre about 15 minutes on metro. Buy a T-10 and no problemo! Highly recommended. Get tickets for the footie-awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Space and courtesy in Europe with brilliant spa”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc009
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days in this hotel and was surprised to find good spacious room by European standards. Staff was courteous and tried to be helpful. reaching ramblas was not too difficult as train station was nearby and just 8-10 minutes walk. Spa was amazing and at offer price of 7.5 Euros for 90 minutes it was worth. Reaching airport was easy and quick by car or metro though I preferred the metro as I had unutilized tickets. Buffet breakfast for vegetarians was poor. Dr A M Jerath

Reviews.Title: “way overpriced, miles from everything except nou camp”
Reviews.Author: 211855Elaine
Reviews.Content: The whole experience was terrible. The hotel is situated in the middle of huge high rise residental appartments. Our bedroom was clean but tiny, it had bunk beds for adults & children alike, we were afraid to use the top bunks as our air conditioning was worked by a large ceiling fan which came very close to the bed so we ended up sleeping on the matresses on the floor as there were no other rooms available. There is a metro near by which takes you into Barcelona, but if you cant speak Spanish dont bother even trying to get directions to the station from the reception staff as the only map they have does not cover the area the hotel is in. The pool is tiny - five people and its full but the lounging area is large. The only plus is that it is ideal if you are travelling to a match at Camp Nou which is just around the corner and if you only intend staying one night. Taxi into town costs €16 one way and because it is so far out most taxi drivers cannot find it without the use of sat nav. If your thinking of travelling to Barcelona i would defenitely give this hotel a miss, very disappointing overall. We stuck it out because we were only staying two nights any longer and we would have to find alternative accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: andreic77
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very spacious, the breakfast was delicious, the metro station (collblac) is very closed to hotel (7-8 minutes) and the minibar was free.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Mandy59
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff were nice. The hotel is about 14 km away from the city centre and marina were most shop and restaurants are. The spa was not free and i did not know of this till our arrival plus we had to pay 15 Euro pp for breakfast. All in all the hotel is good but could of been a bit closer to other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “do not go”
Reviews.Author: ricardo_g013
Reviews.Content: quite a long way from the city, cab ride took a long time, very distracted/ rude hotel staff , gave two of us the the wrong key card and had to go back and get another one again - and this happened twice .. bathtub was really dirty, was afraid to step in , never got cleaned throughout our stay (we stayed for five days) .. breakfast not worth the 15 Euros, in short overpriced and cannot understand the hype by other customers. When next in Barcelona, we will be definitely avoiding this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmartinezdiaz76
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel of the month of July and we had a very pleasant stay. Also the weather was splendid and we would go there again. really good recomendation for this hotel. XxX Paula

Reviews.Title: “Good for the stadium”
Reviews.Author: randomambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in Barcelona and booked on the basis of other reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel must have been quite grand in 1983 but is very dated now. Compared to 4 star hotels we usually stay in, this was quite a let down. The rooms were small and rather shabby. We requested a non-smoking room but it stank of cigarettes and we had to be moved. Only 1 pillow (which was very flat) was provided per person. The only saving grace is that the service was of a good level. This hotel may have the facilities of a 4 star hotel but due to how dated it is and the averageness of the rooms, it is more like a 3 star. Great location for the stadium but should not be considered a good base for sightseeing downtown.

Reviews.Title: “really pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam123Montreal
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful trip to Barcelona and really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and quiet with all the extras that make your stay really enjoyable: refrigerator, kettle, iron, hair dryer, great bathtub, electronic safe, good mattresses with choice of pillows if you ask, great breakfast buffet, and on and on. The staff were very helpful. It was my girlfriend's birthday, and we mentioned it on checking in -- a couple of hours later they sent up a bottle of champagne and a basket of fruit. The hotel is a 5-min walk to the Colblanc metro station, so very easy access to everything. In a quiet residential area near the soccer stadium, so walking from the metro in the evening is no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “KosmasAmorgos”
Reviews.Author: kosmasAmorgos
Reviews.Content: Really nice Hotel , very clean,wi-fi work's great, very cheap near to Barcelona's team stadium , also has a Metro station very close .

Reviews.Title: “good quiet hotel , nice stuff , a bit away from city centre”
Reviews.Author: Amorgos7
Reviews.Content: Been there for its price , its proximity to Camp nou and other small nice touches such as free mini bar , spa available , wireless free internet . Negatives are the size of our room ( extremely small for 4 persons ) , pool on last floor was closed although we had been told it is open , a bit far away from city centre although metro and buses are not so far . Stuff were excellent . Buffet breakfast very very good , you could have omelette , bacon , scrambled eggs , sausages made for you on that minute infront of you . We were there also for Barca's football match and the location of the hotel was really helpful . Generally a quiet hotel for a good price but not of course on the city center of Barcelona .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit far away from the metro.”
Reviews.Author: Duke_tran_97
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and great breakfast. Too bad that it does not have conge or hot soup in the morning. It is room enough and very clean. I would go back if I were to happen to re-visit Barcelona. The only problem is that it is a few blocks from the subway station. Other than that it was great and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrinnyEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights especially to visit Nou Camp stadium with 12yr old son. Nice lobby , helpful staff. Room large clean , no faults, mini bar was free and filled up each day. Roof top swimming pool with sun chairs, pool ok though not large. Hotel situated in residential area, but fine for Nou Camp.Parking in underground car par 15euros per day, breakfast extra 12 euros so we went down road to cafe for coffee and croisants. Taxi into centre of Barcelona about 13-15 euros, but you could get metro. We went on tour bus from nou camp all around Barcelona , hopping on and off, very good value and recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very good with small flaws”
Reviews.Author: 8KAP8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located quite far from center (5 min walk to metro + about 20-25 min to Drassanes, including one change), but one can get used to it, so it is not a really big disadvantage. You should buy T-10 or even T-30, if you are going to stay for at least a couple of days. Camp Nou is 5 min walk, and there you can have a tour inside the stadium (which is really interesting), visit museum and official shop. The area did not seem neither quiet neither dangerous to me; I did not have any problems. There are a lot of excavations nearby --- they are building Metro Line 9, which will connect the area directly with the airport. When it is complete, this will be a big plus. The hotel is tightly surrounded by buildings (and has almost no of its own area); those building are even higher than the hotel itself, so there is no view from the roof, and the people from those houses can observe everything on the hotel roof and in the pool. The room was quite big and well-equipped. Free WiFi (and with a high speed!; WiFi is also available in halls, but with worse quality), free minibar with non-alcoholic drinks (see below also about it), CD and cassette player, TV with programs in half a dozen languages, ironing equipment and a big safe (my ~15" notebook fitted without any problems), air-conditioning (you need to get used to it) and a fan at the ceiling. The conditioning turns off when you open the window, which is not very good. There are signs that I could ask for free bathrobes and a set of pillows, but I did not bother for it. The lighting system of the room is quite complicated: you need to insert your key-card into a special switch to enable any lights (which is convenient, as you simple take the card out on leaving and all the lights go off); but there is some complicated algorithm of operating all the switches to get the required lamp on. I did not manage to understand it, and kept on with try-and-look. The room was quiet, that is, I had no problems with sleeping. The hotel has a small swimming pool on the roof and a sunbathing area around. The pool is really small (about 10x5 meters; they could think on making it bigger, I'd say), but it is really relaxing when you get there after a day of walk (until you come across a group of 3 guys diving into this pool, which, in fact, can turn good too ;) ). The pool closes at 10pm, which is not really convenient, as you would probably like to spend evenings in center. You can have a buffet breakfast in the hotel. It costs 15 euro, which is quite expensive (you can have buffet lunch in center for 10-11 euro), but can prove convenient (not all restaurants open early on the morning). The buffet has a selection of bakery, selection of ham and cheese, some basic fruits, juices, yogurts, cereal, and you can order omlets for you, which I found really tasteful (and which is the main reason why I have taken the breakfast more then one time). There is also a spa center, which I did not use. The staff at the reception was really helpful: they at least spoke and understood good English and answered all my questions. However, the other staff (in particular, the restaurant staff) understands only a very basic English, which is a disadvantage. The minibar contains two small (0.5l) bottles of mineral water, two bottles (0.3l?) of pepsi or fanta etc., one non-alcoholic beer (0.3l?), and three juices (0.2l?). This is really useful, as you need water on long walking days in the city, and you can avoid buying it for big money there; and the is a really big advantage of the hotel. They usually replace it every day, but once they did not at all replace it, and several more times they replaced it partially. On the first occasion I called on the reception, and they immediately fixed it, on other times I did not bother, as I was alone and the replaced amount was enough for me; I was not able to drink it all anyway. However, this is a flaw, I think. So, to sum up, the hotel is very good with a lot of advantages (mini-bar, WiFi, swimming pool, ...), but has some minor flaws (problems with mini-bar, non-English-speaking staff, small pool and short pool hours, expensive breakfast, quite strange air-conditioning, tight surrounding with houses) which you should be ready for, and one big minus --- location. But it seems that all the similar hotels in the center are much more expensive, so this hotel is a good value for money. As some other reviewer has written here, if you can afford a similar hotel in the center, go there, otherwise this one is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jmguzman10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend with my GF and we loved it. We had tickets to watch Barca and to our surprise the hotel is right next to the Camp Nou, literally! We also bought a three day pass for €23 P/P on the touristic bus, which has three main routes, and agin it was perfect. The Touristic bus stop is right outside the staidium, and can be used to get to the centre as well as for sightseeing (Pass needed obviously). The hotel itself is very clean, very confortable and has a free mini bar which is also a nice touch. Staff was helpful too. Lastly, Barcelona is a very very beautiful city and i would recommend 3 to 4 days minimum, although we got to see and do a lot in 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel,clean bright rooms ,good base to tour city,nice lobby area to relax”
Reviews.Author: hill16ontour
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, staff very helpful, good internet room, reasonable room rates.small pool on the roof,pool not used by many guest, nice area to relax after shopping or sightseeing bar on roof not open on 10 night stay in July,but nice area to sunbathe,although wooden loungers could do with soft cushions. did not have breakfast in hotel as was 18.00 per day.did eat in the restaurant, a few times,had set menu on first night ok but limited choice and menu not in english.did have the buffet a couple of nights,much better could eat as much as you like, meat grilled fresh in front of your eyes, good value about 20.00 per head. not much restaurants in area, nice coffee shop accross road serving croissante,danish etc for light breakfeast,tended to eat in port and city centrea area, only downside taxi fare back to hotel at night about 20.00 euro.however during day close to metro and frequent bus service (bus stops easy to following listing routes etc. overall great hotel, but is 25mins taxi ride to port olympic,but is close to nou camp. you can get the open top tour bus (get 2 day pass) excellant value and great way to see city includes discount for boat tour of harbour and breathtakung cable car accross the port. would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Superb Senator”
Reviews.Author: NIckHughes
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 day break in Barcelona and stayed at the wonderful Senator Hotel. It is a bit out of the city centre which is an advantage for getting to everywhere else in Barcelona, it is also only 5 minutes walk from the Camp Nou. 10 minutes Metro ride to les Rambles and many other attractions around the city. I took my girlfriend as a birthday present, I happened to mention this in an email and on the first night upon returning to our room there was a bottle of Bubbly and a fruit basket.....It was a lovely surprise for my girlfriend and a very special added touch. The hotel is really good value for money, the food is fantastic and the staff are very friendly and helpful with anything asked of them. I would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Barcelona and I will definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Senator”
Reviews.Author: NIckHughes
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 day break in Barcelona and stayed at the wonderful Senator Hotel. It is a bit out of the city centre which is an advantage for getting to everywhere else in Barcelona, it is also only 5 minutes walk from the Camp Nou. 10 minutes Metro ride to les Rambles and many other attractions around the city. I took my girlfriend as a birthday present, I happened to mention this in an email and on the first night upon returning to our room there was a bottle of Bubbly and a fruit basket.....It was a lovely surprise for my girlfriend and a very special added touch. The hotel is really good value for money, the food is fantastic and the staff are very friendly and helpful with anything asked of them. I would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Barcelona and I will definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “So you can find a quiet hotel in Barcelona city”
Reviews.Author: Torremaules
Reviews.Content: We wanted silence and quietness, nowadays it is hard to find a quiet hotel in Barcelona city, away from any crowded touristic place and not invaded by hordes of noisy tourists. Okay, it is nowhere near the center, but it has the Collblanc tube station some 400m away. Room is really soundproofed, with a second door separating the small entrance. Double bed is 160 cm wide. Bathroom has full bathtub. Room also has free minibar (no spirits, just coke, orange, and such), electric keettle and tea/coffee service, radio and cd player (good even if somewhat aged, it still has cassette player!), and free wifi. Breakfast buffet is superb. We got a very good all-included deal with booking.com, reserving about a month in advance. We did not use the spa (extra charge), althought it looks like very much like the one at the Senator in Cadiz (which we used about a year ago).

Reviews.Title: “Located right next to Nou Camp”
Reviews.Author: KUKLS
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a business trip. only found out by chance that this hotel is within 5 min walk to CF barcelona nou-camp stadion. bus/metro leading to downtown also within walking distance. rooms are equipped with aircondition and very clean. hotel has a indoor pool and the rooms minibar is free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: sweetmisery1984
Reviews.Content: I surprised my boyfriend with a trip to Barcelona for our 2nd anniversary. This hotel seemed to tick all the boxes, luxury, style, good customer service, awesome breakfast, free mini-bar and even a spa. When we arrived we were concerned about the distance of the hotel from the city centre but it seemed well worth it. We had no problems finding buses and the staff seemed friendly and helpful when needed. The room was beautiul, and overlooked the front fountain. The breakfast was ample and there were lot's of choices including cereral, muffins, croissants, toast, a host of jams, meats, fruits, salads etc. Spoilt for choice! The free mini-bar was a wonderful touch, and was re-stocked every day. The 3 nights we stayed were wonderfully comfortable and I really would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go unless you're a business person”
Reviews.Author: adlon
Reviews.Content: I just got back from this smug self-satisfied hotel today (11/7/08) with a party of great school children who caused no trouble, were well behaved and a joy to be with, yet any time we wanted help, we needed something or asked the hotel to put themselves out slightly, they did nothing but be obstructive. On the first night they'd not even made up some of the pupils beds at 11pm (and these children were 10 years old), one room had broken electrical socket and they just warned the children to not touch it (taking three days to do anything, and then leaving a dangerous pair of scissors). If you're thinking of bringing a school party; don't. They hate children, the British and it seemed everybody in general. This hotel helped put me off ever going to Barcelona again, and they are so dumb that they put 22 children off as well (and these are the sons and daughter of very wealthy people). Short-sighted, rude and arrogant. I hope the place burns down and takes the desk staff with it. That said, the little people (bar staff, cleaners and waiters) were great and tried hard (don't they always).

Reviews.Title: “What a Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jadesamjordan
Reviews.Content: What a Fab Hotel. Free mini bar - with soft drinks and 2 bottles of beer - always replaced everyday. We added our own small cans of Amstel - they did not mind - and only 3 Euros for 12 small cans - Bargain. The staff were ace, especially David (Spelt Wrong) the Bald Italian Door man - very good english and supports Man U - lol. Bar area is lovely for a quite drink - food not very good though. We had a family room with a double sofa bed - myself and husband had reclyning beds and 7yr old daughter had the sofa bed just at the side of us - it was a very large room and plenty of room for us all. The rooms are very very clean with little toileteries in the bathroom, shaving kit and comb etc and a small sewing kit in the wardrobe. Free safe box in room too. Very quiet hotel. Only 5 mins walk to Nou Camp, and here you can catch the Tour Bus for around Barcelona and costs 26 Euros for 2 days - saves on taxis and also you can go to the Port too. Saves a fortune and you get to see the city all over. Great food - can recommend Hard Rock Cafe in the centre - brilliant. Only cost us 20 Euros for Taxi from Airport and 25 Euros going back to Airport on the Friday night - takes about 20 mins in a taxi. If you dont mind travelling into the centre and want to be near Football ground - this hotel is perfect. If you want to be near centre - this is not for you. Only problem we found - if you have small children and they need a nap in the afternoon - it is a long way to travel back and then have to pay to go back to the centre again - but older kids will be fine. I would go back and love it - 4 days not enough - jsut as you find your feet and get your bearings it is time to come home. What a place. Loved it. Any questions just ask !!!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're wtaching the football....”
Reviews.Author: europeandeco
Reviews.Content: If you are booking the Senator because you have booked an FC Barcelona game, great. Otherwise, book a hotel closer to the city centre. The hotel is more 3 than 4 star. Be aware there is no air conditioning, only ceiling fans which are noisy when left on all night as the rooms are very hot. The rooms themselves were adequate. The pool on the roof is closed for all of May. Breakfast was a mixed bag. Quite a wait to queue for cooked items (eggs, sausages etc). The plate I picked up had dried egg on it and the glass for my orange, a previous guests lipstick! The cold breakfast buffet was good though. I would definitely avoid the restaurant. The three of us had a 21 euro set menu. Only two of the three starters available and only one of three desserts. To cap it all we had to laugh as the one remaining item became unavailable and myself and a guest opposite were each given a pot of yogurt as dessert. In summary, for the footie it's ideal. For the city, you'll regret it.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: EJH20
Reviews.Content: A few teething problems at start of stay but these were resolved fairly quickly by staff at reception . Good hotel - nice reception area, 4 internet terminals -1euro for 10 mins. Breakfast - had large selection of choice ie breads, ham, cheese, pastries + rolls fruit etc and a chef to cook fresh eggs, omlettes, bacon + sausages also different friut juices + cava wine if wanted. Rooms - alittle on the small side for us ie 2 adult + 1 child but functional - adequate towels soaps etc. provided - mini bar free!! soft drinks + beer + tea + coffee facilities Room service we used twice + the second time we had to send food back as it was cold but this was sorted very quickly. Spa - I thought a little expensive it cost 15euro per adult + 7.50euro per child - but the children were only permitted to use it between 10am - 11.30 am which shortened your day for doing other things. Area - 5mins walk from CAMP NOU well worth a visit even if you are not into football but go early ie 10am as it gets very busy later on. Metro 5mins walk around the corner so very handy for transport to everywhere. Just to the right of collblanc metro station is a hiving area of bustling activity small markets + stalls + good at night. There are also a couple of good fruit shops + cafe bars close by and a hairdressers called EGO - which my mother attended for a cut + blow dry excellant work! Overall a nice stay, good location, nice area, easy access, taxi from airport 30euro.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay here”
Reviews.Author: mkivu
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Large, clean, nice rooms (no balcony). Free minibar (don't look for champagne). Not in a central area, but 10 min from the metro station Collblanc

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite City on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: KeepExploring08
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were a little nervous because the hotel seems slightly removed from Barcelona's city center and main attractions. Most of Barcelona's sights are not walking distance from the hotel but the metro is efficient and accessible so it really didn't effect our stay. The hotel concierge was extremely friendly and helpful. They made us dinner reservations and helped us with Flamenco dancing tickets. We called the front desk 15 minutes before we needed to leave for the airport and they called us a cab. The room was quiet and clean. Simple. Room service was on time but the pizza was made with an anchovy-like paste (yuck) and the burger was less than desirable. Stick to restaurants in and about the town! Aqua del Playa (hotel's jacuzzi/indoor pool) is not worth the money. We never ate at the hotel restaurant. There are too many great places in the city...in fact, many great restaurants are in walking distance. Our favorite-Lombardos-is just a few blocks away. We enjoyed Sangria at the hotel bar after long days of trekking around. I am neutral in my recommendation. If you can spend more money then stay at a hotel located in the heart of Barcelona. If this hotel is in your price range then it's a safe bet. Either way, it's impossible not to enjoy such a spectacular city!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeanMaynooth_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back last night from 5 nights in the Senator Hotel , Cardenal Reig, Barcelona. Nice staff, nice room, ok pool on the roof and a great complimentary mini bar. Breakfasts although an extra well worth checking out. The spa too also an extra was very relaxing. Access to the metro in Collblanc is just a short stroll away. The only problem is the amount of stairs which you need to use which is not conpletely suitable for buggys if travelling on your own with a small child. Overall Barcelona has a lot for the visitor , llovely restaurants, friendly people and lots to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Frogwell
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel where we went for a conference nearby. The hotel was a little way out of the centre, I wouldn't stay here if you want to be near the Ramblas etc, having said that it was only a 15 euro cab ride to the top of the ramblas and about 15 minutes on the metro to the Placa de Catalunya. It's very near Camp Nou stadium, and was ideally placed for the Palau de congress where our conference was held. We were very impressed with the hotel. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, good air conditioning, lots of little freebees like a mini bar stocked with fruit juice, beer, water and other soft drinks which was free. Nice tasteful decor and good sized bathroom. Also very quiet. We all slept very well. The food in the hotel was average in the bar, with omlettes and sandwiches etc, not a menu designed to blow you away but not too bad. Breakfast was amazing - a range of pastries, bread, cheeses, serrano ham, tuna, smoked salmon, fruit, even champagne. I don't know how you could have more for breakfast really. We didn't eat here for dinner. The bar staff were friendly and served fabulous cocktails. We didn't go in the spa because it seemed a little too formal, but we spent lots of time on the roof, where there is a lovely little rooftop pool and sun loungers, we really enjoyed being up there. There was no bar though which was a shame, but you could call down and get them to bring drinks up. We thought the service in the hotel was very good indeed, apart from the maids who did the rooms. They were clean enough, but they did things like not give you any loo roll so you had to call down and ask for one (no spares in the bathroom), and didn't restock the free mini bar one day (annoying when you want water) so that was a bit below what you would expect from a 4* hotel. Also, the white cushions on the sun loungers on the roof are so filthy they must be a health hazard and should be destroyed!! If anything needs a good wash, it's those. They coud make a lot more of the roof terrace to be honest, it needed attention but we still enjoyed it. Overall, this was a very 'business' hotel and I would stay here again if I was going to a conference in the area, but I would probably find somewhere a bit more 'holiday' geared if I was coming here for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has changed”
Reviews.Author: Revs54
Reviews.Content: Barcelona: Spa Senator Date: April 14, 2007 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Liverpool UK We have just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. We stayed there 18 months ago and had a great time. Standards have slipped and we were disappointed for the following reasons. 1. Staff in the Spa were arrogant and rude 2. Service in the restaurant for dinner was poor e.g. the soup was lukewarm and vegetables for the main course arrived 10 minutes after the steak. Roast potatoes were sliced potatoes covered in cooking oil. 3. There were pieces of fusewire on the bed by one of the pillows. 4. The return taxi to the airport (organised by the hotel) was 15 euros dearer than the taxi we arrived in.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: andybCardiff
Reviews.Content: just returned from the spa senator after five great nights there from the 18/01/07. the hotel is really nice,really clean and the staff couldunt be more helpful and pleasent. location is good especially for the fotball fans out there. takes about five/ten mins on the metro from collblanc to the main attractions ie the ramblas and since your not staying on the ramblas the hotel is half the price of similar four stars! only fault myself and my partner found was the breakfast. wasunt upto much. would really recomend the spa in the basement for a relaxing time. if you stay on a weekend check if they have a half price discount on the sunday. they did when we went. if you like tapas there is a lovely little tapas bar/resturant accross the road from the hotel and to the left called bien cafe or somthing similar. freindly staff and reasonable english.you pay about one and a half euros for a bottle of beer there which is cheap. all in all will surely go back to this hotel for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you're going to the football.”
Reviews.Author: Stu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a second stay at this good hotel. The proximity to the Camp Nou stadium makes this a winner for anyone going to watch Barcelona play. The rooms are well-appointed, and I found no problems with the staff, who were universally helpful and friendly. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom clean and well set out with shaving equipment, dental kit and usual toiletries, and the minibar was well stocked and free, which is a plus in any hotel. TV has BBC world, CNN and Eurosport in English and there was a stereo CD system. I didn't use the bars or restaurants, so cannot comment. Breakfast was not included in the €74 charge for the double room. If you use the metro to go to town, go to Collblanc station, about ten minutes walk away along a slight gradient. The hour to travel mentioned elsewhere is a bit generous, but certainly allow 30 minutes. If Barcelona centre is the main purpose for your visit, or if you are of restricted mobility, I would consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The 4 stars that go along with the hotel are very deceiving. The hotel staff made my stay in Barcelona a terrible experience, not to mention the several items in my room were taken while I was out visiting the city or while I was at breakfast. Even locked items were broken into. I felt unsafe during the rest of my stay at this hotel, and the staff did not offer help or any apologies for all the trouble I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Good news hotel”
Reviews.Author: ferg082
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel, like the others due to its proximity to the Camp Nou, which was just as well as the journey from Gerona took over three hours. The hotel is literally a 5 minute jog from the stadium and is ideal if you are going to a game. The hotel does seem to have problems with its computers though, as on arrival we were told that they would have to transfer us for a night to another hotel. That said the staff could not have been more apologetic and were very helpful in resolving the issue. They organised a prepaid taxi to take us to the AC Barcelona ( a superior 4 star) and while we waited they provided us with complimentary food and drink. The staff were polite and attentive and certainly not as described. We were given the option of either staying at the AC Barcelona or returning to the Senator (at their cost) - which we did. The rooms, whilst not huge, are very well equipped and comfortable and have a complimentary minibar (softdrinks and beer). The piona bar is large and staff very friendly, although there is not a great atmosphere during the week but hey who is going to sit in the bar when downtown Barca is just a few stops away on the metro! The spa complex is as good as I've seen and worth every penny of the 15 euro it will cost you (but even better when its free on account of the booking hassle.) We stumbled across the restaurant by accident and if you can't find something you like on the buffet you must be a hugely fussy eater. There is every type of salad, cold meats, cheeses, shell fish etc and then the Chef will cook you chicken, fish, pork, pastas, crepes. This is all for under 20 eur a head which to my mind was great value. The location of the hotel is great for the Camp Nou but otherwise there is not much to do nearby. That said the Metro is 5 minutes walk away and with regular trains ( every couple of mins) you are no more than 10 minutes away from Ramblas, Passeig de Gracia, Sangrada. If you want to get a taxi back it will cost about 8 Eur. All in a very good experince and I would definitely stay at the Senator Spa again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the footy.. but you could die of thirst!”
Reviews.Author: sallyg123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Senator with my husband and three teenage children, one of whom is a huge Barca fan. We had tickets for a late season match, which, at the last minute, was scheduled for live TV broadcasting at 10pm. Luckily, the Senator is only a 10-15 minute walk from the Nou Camp stadium and so we would able to walk back home at around midnight on Saturday, instead of crushing into Metro trains or trying to find a cab. For reason of this convenience, I would stay at the Senator again - but not for any other reason. The hotel is clean and smart but the staff do not make guests feel wanted in any way (except for one very pleasant waiter). When we arrived, after a delayed Iberia flight, we waited ages at reception for the one receptionist on duty to finish dealing with another guest. It was still only around 9pm on a Friday evening, so why such meagre staffing? The receptionist told us that our booking had been cancelled by our tour operator (yes, really!!), and that, despite the fact that we had paid for our three-night stay in advance, she could find us rooms for one night only, as the hotel was going to be completely full on the next night...but they would try fo help us find another hotel! So much for choosing a hotel close to the football ground! I found it hard to sleep that night, worrying that I would have to spend the first day of our weekend in Barcelona searching for and moving to another hotel. Judging by the packed flight we had from London, Barcelona was going to be choc-full of tourists for the bank holiday weekend. There was no point in unpacking our cases, and the children kept asking where we were going to go. Anyway, to cut a long story short, after several calls the next morning to Air Miles (with whom I had booked the trip) to try to find out what had gone wrong with the booking, I went down to the reception desk mid-morning to see if the duty manager had an explanation for me, and, hopefully, a solution to my accommodation problem. Yes, he knew all about our problem, but it was all OK; it had been a 'computer error' - on whose part, I don't know - but we would be able to stay for the full three nights after all! It was obviously a great relief to hear that news, but why it hadn't occurred to him to pick up the phone, ring my hotel room, put me out of my misery, and save me a few quid in mobile call charges, I don't know! The Senator's staff shortages are not limited to the reception desk. The piano bar had no pianist and the bar could also do with more staff (the service is very slow). Learning how to smile at guests would do a lot to make them feel more welcome. Apart from all that, the supposedly a la carte restaurant only served basic buffet fare and it costs €15 to use the spa.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for a break in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cuddlyelephant
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights here last week and were not dissapointed. The hotel is clean with pleasant fountains/water features both outside and inside the hotel. The rooms are a decent size although not massive, but they have some very nice touches like reclining beds, free mini bar (soft drinks and beer) and free use of bathrobes and slippers. The views from our room were just of apartment blocks but pleasant enough I would recommend the spa which is a great place to relax for a couple of hours. there are several jacuzis/plunge pools and a sauna, and a small indoor pool, large enough to have a swim in. Breakfast was decent with bacon and eggs if you want it (cooked fresh) plus all the usual meats, cheeses and pastries. we had the buffet dinner once in the hotel and this was fine- you get a large salad selection, soup, meat, pasta, sauces, and just go up and get what you want for 20 euros. the hotel's locations is wonderful for visiting the nou-camp,we were lucky enough to get champions league tickets to barcelona v benfica. its just a 15 minute gentle stroll to the stadium. the nou-camp is also the place where you can catch the tourist bus that takes you to all the tourist attractions of the city. the subway is about a 15 minute walk away. really, its quite nice to get away from the busy city centre and come to a pleasant suburban area that the hotel is in. definately recommend this hotel. if you want to be in the middle of everything its probably not for you but if you dont mind staying a bit out of the centre you'll find this a very pleasant hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Senator Barcelona Spa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: C/Cardenal Reig 11, 08028 Barcelona, Spain
